author: cschoett
msg: First pass at a new JDBC system control sample.  This sample demonstrates the following with the JDBC system control:
1) Testing a control out-of-container with JUnit
2) Calling Derby stored procedures from a JDBC control
3) Using a JDBC control custom result set mapper
The sample requires that the Apache Derby jar is available on the users system.

author: jm
msg: masses: ensure that T_ rules are clamped to a score of 0.01 for perceptron runs, since they're only for testing

author: cschoett
msg: Added new annotation attribute to ConnectionOptions annotation, 'useExternalConnection'.  Defaults to false, if set to true, a Jdbc system control will not try to acquire/release the connection specified in its ConnectionDatasource/ConnectionDriver annotation.  The Jdbc connection is provided via the setConnection API. 99% of this behavior already existed in the JDBC control, this change (consisting of 3 new lines of source code) allows users to take advantage of it.   Should be quite useful for JUnit testing of controls in the ControlTestContainer.  See the updated unit test for an example of usage.

author: jhawkins
msg: [MUSE-192] Cannot use -SNAPSHOT in OSGi manifest version numbers
